page.title: 19CHILDREN
page.content: In the summer the children go down to the dale to swim in the river. The river is dammed up so it is deep enough to swim in: the river would be about 2 metres deep. About 20 people swim in the river at any one time. Also in the dale the children go catching bullyheads. They turn the rocks over and put their hands on the bottom. They also play out on their bikes or go down to the playing fields, where there are swings, slides and other play equipment, two tennis courts, a football pitch and a cricket square. Also in the summer the children go hay-making with their friends who live on the farms. In the winter children stay inside and play on a computer, at monopoly, watch television or read quietly. Scotch arrows is the "in" game at the moment. Robert Brassington (11)
